carbon-models.name: Estimated carbon storage, 2000-2009
carbon-models.info: Carbon storage, estimated as total carbon density (metric tonnes per hectare) in all vegetation. USFS Forest Inventory and Analysis (FIA) program.

carbon-models.name: LanDAT carbon storage model
carbon-models.info: Carbon storage, estimated as total carbon density (metric tonnes per hectare) in all vegetation. LanDAT model using 2000-2015 MODIS data, trained on FIA estimates.

carbon-models.name: Landscape Shift in Carbon Storage
carbon-models.info: Long-term (decadal) expected gains and losses in carbon density, estimated from observed annual changes in LanDAT phenological variables.

summary-phenology.name: Summary phenology: seasonality and timing
summary-phenology.info: Factor scores describing the strong majority of the variation in the phenology variables. Those shown here are closely associated with (1) seasonality, and with (2) the day-of-year variables such as the middle of the growing season.

summary-phenology.name: Summary phenology: timing
summary-phenology.info: Factor scores describing the strong majority of the variation in the phenology variables. Those shown here are closely associated with only the day-of-year variables such as the beginning, middle, and end of the growing season.

boundaries.name: States
boundaries.info: U.S. state borders from the U.S. Census Bureau's TigerLine products

boundaries.name: Counties
boundaries.info: U.S. county borders from the U.S. Census Bureau's TigerLine products

boundaries.name: AppLCC region
boundaries.info: Regional boundary of the Appalachian Land Conservation Cooperative (AppLCC)

ancillary.name: Landscape Mosaic Pattern
ancillary.info: An index measuring the mixture of agricultural, developed, and semi-natural land cover types within 15-hectare (37-acre) neighborhoods. US Forest Service, based on the 2011 National Land Cover Database.

ancillary.name: Landscape Forest Density
ancillary.info: An index estimating the proportion of the landscape around a given forest area that is also forested, measured within 15-hectare (37-acre) neighborhoods. Low-density areas may be fragmented by non-forest land uses or natural non-forest cover. US Forest Service, based on the 2011 National Land Cover Database.

ancillary.name: Total Tree Basal Area
ancillary.info: Estimated total tree basal area. USFS Forest Health Technology Enterprise Team, 2012.

ancillary.name: Tree Basal Area at Risk from Insect and Disease Pathogens
ancillary.info: Percent of basal area estimated to be at risk. USFS Forest Health Technology Enterprise Team, 2012.

ancillary.name: Decline in Evergreen Vegetation, 2000-2011
ancillary.info: Rate of decline in the evergreen (non-deciduous) component of vegetation greenness (NDVI) from 2000 to 2011. Higher values indicate stronger decline.

ancillary.name: Housing Density, 2010
ancillary.info: Housing units per squ. km, by partial census block group. US Census Bureau and SILVIS Lab.

ancillary.name: Palmer Drought Severity Index, 2000-2015 Mean
ancillary.info: Self-calibrated drought index (scPDSI); mean monthly value, 2000-2015. Values below -0.5 indicate drier than normal.

ancillary.name: Palmer Drought Severity Index, 2000-2015 Variability
ancillary.info: Self-calibrated drought index (scPDSI); inter-annual variability, 2000-2015. Higher values indicate more year-to-year variation.

ancillary.name: Historical Fires from 2000 to 2016
ancillary.info: Shows locations and intensities of fires that occured from 2000 to 2016

ancillary.name: Historical Fires from 1984 to 1999
ancillary.info: Shows locations and intensities of fires that occured from 1984 to 1999

it-metrics.name: Rate of Inter-annual Change
it-metrics.info: The proportion of inter-annual change events in which a change in phenoclass occurs (as opposed to phenoclass stability).

it-metrics.name: Rate of Change: Increases
it-metrics.info: The proportion of inter-annual change events that are associated with increased productivity (increasing NDVI)

it-metrics.name: Rate of Change: Decreases
it-metrics.info: The proportion of inter-annual change events that are associated with decreased productivity.

it-metrics.name: Shannon Diversity
it-metrics.info: Landscape information metric summarizing the total diversity, or complexity, of observed landscape dynamics.

it-metrics.name: Mutual Information
it-metrics.info: Landscape information metric representing the component of overall complexity which is higly predictable, or organized.

it-metrics.name: Conditional Entropy
it-metrics.info: Landscape information metric representing the component of overall complexity which is higly unpredictable, disorganized, or redundant.

it-metrics.name: Development
it-metrics.info: Mutual Information standardized by Shannon Diversity: the proportion of the complexity which is accounted for by the predictable component.

it-metrics.name: Capacity
it-metrics.info: Landscape information metric summarizing the complexity of landscape dynamics, and overall productivity (Shannon Diversity multiplied by mean NDVI).

it-metrics.name: Ascendency
it-metrics.info: Landscape information metric summarizing the predictability of landscape dynamics, and overall productivity  (Mutual Information multiplied by mean NDVI).

it-metrics.name: Overhead
it-metrics.info: Landscape information metric summarizing the unpredictability of landscape dynamics, and overall productivity (Conditional Entropy multiplied by mean NDVI).

phenology-variables.name: Mean Growing Season Greenness
phenology-variables.info: Mean NDVI within the growing season, i.e., between the beginning and end of growing season dates.

phenology-variables.name: Degree of Seasonality, or Deciduousness
phenology-variables.info: Crowding of NDVI greenness into a particular portion of the annual cycle, measured by the length of the mean greenness vector. More evergreen vegetation shows lower seasonality.

phenology-variables.name: Beginning of Growing Season
phenology-variables.info: Start of the growing season measured as the point in time when 15 percent of the total annual greenness has already occurred. This is an arbitrary benchmark, applied in a standard way across all cells and years.

phenology-variables.name: Middle of Growing Season
phenology-variables.info: Middle of the growing season. This is determined by the direction, or angle on the annual cycle, of the mean greenness vector.

phenology-variables.name: End of Growing Season
phenology-variables.info: End of the growing season measured as the point in time when 85 percent of the total annual greenness has already occurred. This is an arbitrary benchmark, applied in a standard way across all cells and years.

phenology-variables.name: Growing Season Length
phenology-variables.info: Number of days between the beginning and end of growing season dates.

phenology-variables.name: Within-year Greenness Variability
phenology-variables.info: Standard deviation of NDVI; a measure of variability in greenness among 8-day periods within the year.

phenoclasses.name: Multi-Annual Phenoclasses
phenoclasses.info: Classification of cells into 500 phenological classes, placing each cell into only one class, using data from all years.

phenoclasses.name: 500 Phenoclasses, 2001
phenoclasses.info: Classification of cells into one of 500 phenological classes, using phenology data from a single year. The year is a 'phenological year' rather than a calendar year, but it corresponds broadly to the indicated calendar year.

phenoclass-derived.name: Total Year-to-Year Path Length
phenoclass-derived.info: Total summed amount or 'length' of all annual phenological changes from 2000 to 2015; a measure of the cumulative degree of change.

phenoclass-derived.name: Final Between-years Distance
phenoclass-derived.info: Amount of phenological difference between the first and last years, 2000 and 2015; analogous to a straight-line distance rather than the path length.

phenoclass-derived.name: Maximum Year-to-Year Step
phenoclass-derived.info: The single largest annual phenological change observed between any two consecutive years.

phenoclass-derived.name: Mean Year-to-Year Step
phenoclass-derived.info: The mean annual phenological change observed between consecutive years.

phenoclass-derived.name: Minimum Year-to-Year Step
phenoclass-derived.info: The smallest annual phenological change observed between any two consecutive years.

phenoclass-derived.name: Maximum Between-years Distance
phenoclass-derived.info: The amount of phenological difference between the two most different years, from 2000 to 2015.

phenoclass-derived.name: Mean Between-years Distance
phenoclass-derived.info: The mean phenological difference between any two years, regardless of order, from 2000 to 2015.

phenoclass-derived.name: Minimum Between-years Distance
phenoclass-derived.info: The amount of phenological difference between the two most similar years, from 2000 to 2015.

phenoclass-derived.name: High NDVI
phenoclass-derived.info: Highest mean annual NDVI reached, from 2000 to 2015.

phenoclass-derived.name: Low NDVI
phenoclass-derived.info: Lowest mean annual NDVI reached, from 2000 to 2015.

longtermlandshift.name: Landscape Compositional Shift
longtermlandshift.info: Expected shift in landscape composition, in terms of phenological classes, on a decadal time scale. Estimated through projection of observed phenological change.

longtermlandshift.name: Long-term Shift in Seasonality
longtermlandshift.info: Expected gains and losses in the value of the Seasonality (deciduousness) variable on a decadal time scale. Estimated through projection of observed phenological change.

longtermlandshift.name: Long-term Shift in Ascendency
longtermlandshift.info: Expected gains and losses in the value of the Ascendency information metric on a decadal time scale. Estimated through projection of observed phenological change.

longtermlandshift.name: Long-term Shift in Conditional Entropy
longtermlandshift.info: Expected gains and losses in the value of the Conditional Entropy information metric on a decadal time scale. Estimated through projection of observed phenological change.
